title: Havencrest Capital Doubles Down on Healthcare With $356 Million Fund
sub_head: The firm closes its second healthcare-focused fund with more than twice the capital collected for a predecessor
body:
Havencrest Capital Management has raised $356 million for its second fund focused on investing in smaller healthcare companies, as investors continue to reward specialist investment managers.
“Healthcare is a very nuanced industry,” said Christopher W. Kersey, who founded Havencrest in 2017 after a career backing healthcare deals at growth equity firm Camden Partners. “You really do need to have lived it to understand what’s happening with the trends [and] to avoid areas that might be overly burdensome.”
